metadata.title: Wednesday, 19th June, 2019
metadata.session: THIRD SESSION OF THE TWELFTH ASSEMBLY

parts: (a) whether the Government has any plans to upgrade Zamtan Health Centre in Kamfinsa Parliamentary Constituency to a first level hospital;
(b) if so, when the plans will be implemented; and
(c) if there are no such plans, why.
(a) whether the Government has any plans to construct a district hospital in Katete;
(b) if so, when construction works will commence;
(c) what the cost of the project is; and
(d) what the time frame for the completion of the project is.

(a) whether the Government has applied to the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organisation (UNESCO) for the recognition of the Kuomboka Ceremony as a Masterpiece of Oral and Intangible Heritage of Humanity;
(b) if so, what the status of the application is; and
(c) if an application has not been made, why.
(a) when the tarring of township roads in Chadiza, which stalled in 2016, will resume;
(c) what the total cost of the project is;
(d) how much money had been paid to the contractor as of December, 2018; and
(e) what the time frame for the completion of the outstanding works is.
(a) whether the Government has any plans to construct a local court building in Chilanga Parliamentary Constituency; and
(b) if so, when the plans will be implemented.
